Justification: To assess for any tenderness, guarding, or rebound tenderness, which can be indicative of peritoneal irritation.
To assess for any masses or enlarged organs, which can be suggestive of appendicitis or other abdominal pathology.
To assess for any signs of inflammation or infection, such as redness, swelling, or warmth.
To assess for any signs of dehydration, which can be a common symptom of appendicitis.
